wikipedia_page.main: Agnes Lyon (1762–1840) was a Scottish humorous poet of the 18th and 19th century.

response: The humorous poet Agnes Lyon lived in the town.J. C. Hadden, ‘Lyon, Agnes (1762–1840)’, rev. Sarah Couper, Oxford Dictionary of National Biography, Oxford University Press, 2004 accessed 31 Jan 2015
His aunt was the poet Agnes Lyon.

L'Amy was born on 8 July 1772 the son of Agnes (née) Hamilton and John Ramsay L'Amy of Dunkenny, Forfarshire. His older sister was the Scottish poet Agnes Lyon. He studied law and qualified as an advocate in 1794.
